DOC.brief_summary: The Neurogenic Dysphonia/Dysphagia Registry design purely observational ( i.e . non-interventional , exploratory ) . Patient data collect registry expect consistent information obtain usual care patient dysphonia/dysphagia treat vocal fold augmentation .
DOC.detailed_description: The Neurogenic Dysphonia/Dysphagia Registry 510K post-clearance multicenter , observational , open-label registry benefit risk management outcome patient neurogenic dysphonia/dysphagia receive vocal fold augmentation ( VFA ) . Enrollment open eligible patient meet inclusion none exclusion criterion , target 400 patient . Up 100 site US abroad part registry . Sites provide retrospective data active patient undergone VFA within past 24 month site also begin prospectively enroll patient receive VFA part usual care . Patients follow five year prospectively , lose follow-up , death .
DOC.criteria: Males Females , ≥18 year age Diagnosis neurogenic dysphonia/dysphagia Under active treatment VFA followup care • Patients : Vocal fold scar Laryngeal cancer defect Irradiation larynx Laryngeal trauma Endstage cancer
